[START IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

The image displays the logo of **Mandiri**, which is a well-known financial institution, particularly in Indonesia.

The logo consists of two main elements:

1. **Text**: The word "mandiri" is written in lowercase letters using a bold, sans-serif typeface. The font is clean and modern, with even stroke weights and rounded terminals. The color of the text is a deep navy blue, which conveys professionalism, trust, and stability.

2. **Graphic Element**: Positioned above the text is a stylized, wavy ribbon or wave-like shape. This graphic is rendered in a gradient of warm golden-yellow to orange, giving it a sense of movement and energy. The shape has three distinct peaks and valleys, resembling a flowing ribbon or a stylized wave, which may symbolize dynamism, growth, or fluidity in financial services.

The overall design is simple, balanced, and modern. The contrast between the dark blue text and the bright, warm graphic creates visual interest and makes the logo memorable. The layout is horizontal, with the graphic centered above the wordmark, creating a cohesive and professional brand identity.

This logo is typically associated with **Bank Mandiri**, one of the largest banks in Indonesia.

# PREFACE


## Purpose

This Specification Document (SD) provides a documentation of the functional and non-functional requirements of application module to support the intended business area needs. It describes the overall processes supported by the application module and its detail requirements covering functional, data, security controls, interfAces, general ledger entries, agreed gaps resolution and etc. The requirements will be based on the scope agreed in the project charter.

This document will form a baseline for the subsequent development Activities such as design, customization, and testing of the application module.

The image displays a handwritten signature in blue ink on a plain white background. The signature consists of two main parts, separated by a period.

- The first part is a large, cursive capital letter "C" with a prominent, sweeping loop that extends upward and to the left, then curves down and to the right. The stroke is smooth and fluid, suggesting it was written with a pen or fine-tipped marker.

- Following the "C" is a period (.), which is small and centered vertically relative to the baseline of the letter.

- The second part of the signature appears to be the name "Ivan" written in a flowing, cursive script. It begins with a capital "I" that has a short vertical stroke and a small, upward flourish at the top. This is followed by a lowercase "v" with a sharp, angular descent, and then an "a" that is formed with a single, continuous loop. The final letter, "n," is written with a quick, slanted stroke that connects to the "a" and ends with a slight upward flick.

The entire signature is written in a single, continuous motion, with consistent pressure and a slightly slanted orientation from left to right. The style is elegant and personal, typical of a formal or official signature. The ink is a solid, dark blue, and the background is completely white, with no other marks or distractions.

[END IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

[START IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

This image is a detailed system architecture diagram illustrating the components and interactions within a software system, centered around a core application called **WFMS** (Workforce Management System). The diagram uses icons, labels, and directional arrows to show data flow, communication protocols, and integration points.

---

### **1. Client Layer (Left Side)**
- **Clients**: Represented by two icons — a desktop computer and a laptop — both labeled "Client". These are the end-user devices accessing the system.
- **Connection to Mandin**: Clients connect to a blue server icon labeled **"mandin"**, which appears to be a gateway or application server. The connection is labeled **"Redirect HTTPS (550)"**, indicating secure communication over port 550.
- **Authentication Flow**: The "mandin" server also communicates with **Keycloak**, an identity and access management (IAM) service, via **"Redirect HTTPS (550)"**. This suggests Keycloak handles user authentication and authorization, likely using OpenID Connect (as indicated by the "OpenID" label above Keycloak).

---

### **2. Core Application: WFMS (Workforce Management System)**
- **Central Component**: The red server icon labeled **WFMS** is the central application. It receives requests from the "mandin" server via **REST API**.
- **Authentication Integration**: WFMS also communicates with **Keycloak** via **"Redirect HTTPS (550)"**, reinforcing that Keycloak manages authentication for the WFMS application.

rlu dijalankan untuk mendukung pertumbuhan bisnis. Hal ini diperkuat kembali dalam Rapat Direksi bulan Juli 2022 yang telah menyampaikan arahan untuk mengeksekusi operation transformation dan mengkaji kembali pemetaan ruang lingkup operation transformation. Sebagai tindak lanjut dari arahan tersebut, kami telah, sedang, dan akan terus mentransformasi seluruh aspek operations mencakup process, technology, people dan organization.

Untuk mengakomodir operations baik di dalam Direktorat Operations maupun di luar Direktorat Operations melalui pembentukan Business Operations Center (BOC) yang merupakan integrasi seluruh kegiatan operations yang ada di suatu kota/kawasan tertentu, maka diperlukan sistem yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable melalui pengembangan Workflow Management System.


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Pengembangan system Workflow Management System Headoffice & BOC | Pengembangan e-channel operation engine untuk seluruh proses operasional sesuai dengan kebutuhan proses bisnis terkini dan dapat terintegrasi dengan channel transaksi digital dan core system Bank Mandiri |

### **1. Front End (Leftmost Column)**

- **Business Unit** (Orange arrow with a person and speech bubble icon): Represents internal business units.
- **Third Party** (Gray arrow with a server icon): Represents external partners or systems.

### **Overall Structure and Flow**

The diagram illustrates a **top-down, left-to-right flow**:

- **Front-end users** (Livin, Kopra, Smart Branch, Business Unit, Third Party) initiate processes.
- These processes are managed through **defined operational workflows** (Data Entry → Verification → Approval → Monitoring → Reporting).
- The **Workflow Management System** acts as the central orchestrator, using **technology enablers** to digitize inputs, route tasks, make decisions, track progress, and generate reports.
- The system is **automated and transparent**, with features like auto-assignment and load balancing.
- It **integrates with numerous backend systems** (listed in the Backend column) and surrounding systems (listed at the bottom), ensuring data consistency and operational efficiency across the organization.

---

### **Design and Color Scheme**

- **Color-coded sections** for clarity: Front End (various colors), Process (blue), Workflow Management System (blue and white), Backend (white with blue border), Integration (white with blue border).
- **Icons** are used to visually represent each front-end entity.
- **Arrows and lines** show relationships and data flow.
- **Consistent typography** and layout enhance readability.

---

### **Conclusion**

This is a comprehensive **system architecture diagram** for a **Workflow Management System** in a financial or banking context (likely Mandiri Bank, given the "Livin by mandiri" and "Smart Branch by mandiri" branding). It emphasizes **digital transformation**, **automation**, **integration**, and **transparency** across front-end operations, core workflows, and backend systems. The diagram serves as a high-level blueprint for stakeholders to understand how different parts of the organization interact through a unified workflow platform.

## 6.2 Security Requirement - Code Security Review


| No | Area | Requirement | Compliance | Comment |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi memiliki rutin / prosedur terpusat mengenai validasi terhadap Input. | Comply |  |
| 2 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi harus bisa memastikan bahwa setiap kegagalan pemenuhan validasi harus berujung pada penolakan Input. | Comply |  |
| 3 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi melakukan proses validasi untuk setiap masukan dari pengguna, termasuk didalamnya URL dan isi dari HTTP Header. | Comply | Dilakukan penjagaan pada saat 'key in', hanya karakter yang diperbolehkan saja yang dapat diinput. |
| 4 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi dapat memastikan bahwa isi dari Header pada saat Request dan Response hanya berupa ASCII karakter | Comply | Dilakukan penjagaan pada saat 'key in', hanya karakter yang diperbolehkan saja yang dapat diinput. |
| 5 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi melakukan validasi terhadap data redirect | Comply | Dilakukan penjagaan pada saat 'key in', hanya karakter yang diperbolehkan saja yang dapat diinput. |
| 6 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi melakukan proses validasi terhadap tipe data | Comply | Dilakukan penjagaan pada saat 'key in', hanya karakter yang diperbolehkan saja yang dapat diinput. |
| 7 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi melakukan proses validasi terhadap range data | Comply | Dilakukan penjagaan pada saat 'key in', sehingga tidak bisa melakukan input lebih dari maximum karakter yang diperbolehkan. |
| 8 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi melakukan proses validasi input di sisi Client maupun Server. | Comply |  |
| 9 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi melakukan proses validasi terhadap length data | Comply |  |
| 10 | Validasi Input | Aplikasi melakukan proses pengecekan terhadap karakter unik seperti : <> " ' % ( ) & + \ \' " dan | Comply |  |


<!-- Page break -->


|  |  | melakukan encode (peng kodean) terhadap karakter karakter unik tersebut. |  |

## Keterangan:

* Data akan diturunkan ke staging (BIX) dilakukan 1 kali dalam sehari.

* Data yang diturunkan adalah case yang group owner nya = BOC / case yang kategori Unit Approver nya = BOC

* Data yang diturunkan adalah case dengan status Resolved-Completed yang di handle oleh BOC.

* Case yang tidak di handle oleh BOC karena STP (Straight True Process) walaupun status nya Resolved-Completed tidak diturunkan.

* Case yang tidak di handle oleh BOC karena kategori Unit Approver nya adalah HO walaupun statusnya Resolved-Completed tidak diturunkan.


<!-- Page break -->

* Penurunan data ke staging (BIX) dilakukan pada jam **05.00 s/d 06.00 WIB**. Sehingga proses ETL ke portal SPO akan dilakukan setelah itu, estimasi pada jam 06.30 WIB. Hal ini dikarenakan:

* Proses alokasi di EMAS selesai sekitar jam 00.00 s/d 01.30 WIB.

* SAP mendapatkan status alokasi dari emas sekitar jam 02.00 s/d 03.00 WIB.

* WFMS mendapatkan status alokasi dari SAP sekitar jam 03.30 s/d 04.30 WIB.

* Pada staging (BIX) akan di create 6 table utama dan 6 table history. Saat menurunkan data, PEGA akan insert ke 6 table utama & juga ke 6 table history.

* 6 table utama hanya akan menyimpan data di hari H. Jika melewati hari H maka data akan di hapus.

* 6 table history akan disimpan selama 7 hari, namun bersifat parameterized.

## 9.1 Technology Architecture


Image Description — Figure 614.1

<!--
source_type: image

interpretation: visual-inference

[START IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

This image is a detailed system architecture diagram illustrating the integration and data flow between various components in a software ecosystem, centered around a core application called **WFMS** (Workforce Management System). The diagram uses standard icons for servers, databases, and clients, with labeled arrows indicating communication protocols and data flow.

(Document Management System)
- These systems communicate with the Pega applications via **CMIS** (Content Management Interoperability Services) or **SOAP/REST API**.

---

## **Backup Infrastructure**

At the bottom of each environment:
- **DB BACKUP** is performed to **NET BACKUP** servers.
- This ensures data is backed up regularly for recovery purposes.

---

## **Key Observations & Design Patterns**

1. **High Availability & Disaster Recovery:**
   - The entire architecture is mirrored between DC and DR.
   - **Oracle Active Data Guard** ensures database replication.
   - **F5 and GTM** provide load balancing and failover capabilities.

2. **SSO & Security:**
   - **Keycloak OpenID** is used for centralized authentication.
   - All user access is secured via **HTTPS**.

3. **Network Segmentation:**
   - Clear separation of IP ranges: **10.238.x.x** for apps, **10.204.x.x** for DC DB, **10.254.x.x** for DR DB.

4. **Application Architecture:**
   - Pega applications are deployed on multiple servers (APP1, APP3, etc.) for scalability.
   - Includes batch processing (BATCH1, BATCH2) and streaming (STREAM1, STREAM2) components.

5. **Integration:**
   - Integrates with external systems like SAP, Mail, and DMS via standard protocols (SMTP, SOAP, REST, CMIS).

---

## **Summary**

This is a **robust, enterprise-grade, high-availability architecture** for a Pega application, designed with **disaster recovery in mind**. The system uses **F5 and GTM for traffic management**, **Oracle RAC with Active Data Guard for database resilience**, and **Keycloak for secure authentication**. The **DC (PLAZMAN)** and **DR (REMPOA)** sites are fully mirrored, ensuring business continuity in case of a failure in the primary site. The design emphasizes **scalability, security, and reliability**.

---

✅ **This diagram is a comprehensive view of a production-grade, resilient IT infrastructure for a financial institution (likely Bank Mandiri), with a strong focus on disaster recovery and system availability.**

[START IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

The image displays a **Case Life Cycle** workflow diagram, likely from a business process management (BPM) or workflow automation tool. The diagram is structured as a horizontal sequence of stages, each containing a list of steps or activities, with icons indicating the type of action or decision.

---

## **Overall Structure**

The workflow is divided into **six main stages**, presented as horizontal tabs at the top:

1. **Create**
2. **Data Entry**
3. **Approval Pemohon** (Approval by Applicant/Requester)
4. **Verification**
5. **Approval Pemutus** (Approval by Decision Maker/Approver)
6. **Posting**

Each stage contains a vertical list of steps, with icons and labels. At the bottom left, there is an additional stage labeled **Cancel**, and a button labeled **+ ALTERNATE STAGE**.

---

## **Stage-by-Stage Breakdown**

### **1. Create**
- **Initiate** (header)
- **+ STEP** (button to add a new step)
- **CONFIGURE PROCESS** (button at the bottom)

This stage appears to be the starting point for initiating a new case.

---

### **2. Data Entry**
- **Is Sendback** (orange diamond icon — likely a decision point)
- **Data Entry** (green document icon — action step)
- **Decision History** (blue branching icon — history or audit trail)
- **Decision History** (repeated)
- **Need Revision** (green document icon — action step)
- **CONFIGURE PROCESS**

This stage involves entering data and handling potential revisions or sendbacks.

---

### **3. Approval Pemohon (Approval by Applicant/Requester)**
- **Approval Unit Kerja** (blue document icon — approval step)
- **Is Approved?** (orange diamond — decision)
- **Is Sendback?** (orange diamond — decision)
- **Decision History** (blue branching)
- **Change Stage to Data En...** (blue branching — likely "Change Stage to Data Entry")
- **CONFIGURE PROCESS**

This stage involves approval from the requesting unit, with decision points for approval or sendback.

---

### **4. Verification**
- **IsHaveVerificator** (orange diamond — decision)
- **WB Verificator** (green document — action, possibly "Workbench Verificator")
- **Decision History** (blue branching)
- **Approval Verificator** (green document — approval step)
- **Is Sendback?** (orange diamond — decision)
- **Decision History** (blue branching)
- **Change Stage to Data En...** (blue branching)
- **CONFIGURE PROCESS**

This stage focuses on verification by a designated verifier, with options to send back or proceed.

---

### **5. Approval Pemutus (Approval by Decision Maker/Approver)**
This is the most complex stage, with multiple approval levels and decision points.

- **Approval Check** (yellow key icon — possibly a check or validation step)
- **Is Need Approval 1** (orange diamond — decision)
- **WB Approval SPV 1** (green document — approval by Supervisor 1)
- **Decision History** (blue branching)
- **Approval SPV 1** (green document — approval step)

- **Is Sendback?** (orange diamond — decision)
- **Change Stage to Data En...** (blue branching)
- **Decision History** (blue branching)
- **Is Need Approval SPV 2?** (orange diamond — decision)
- **WB Approval SPV 2** (green document — approval by Supervisor 2)
- **Decision History** (blue branching)
- **Approval SPV 2** (green document — approval step)
- **Is SPV 2 Approved?** (orange diamond — decision)
- **Decision History** (blue branching)
- **Is Need Approver 3** (orange diamond — decision)
- **Additional Approval SPV** (blue document — additional approval step)
- **Is Approved?** (orange diamond — decision)
- **Decision History** (blue branching)
- **Is Sendback** (orange diamond — decision)
- **CONFIGURE PROCESS**

This stage involves a multi-level approval process, potentially with conditional approvals (SPV 1, SPV 2, and possibly a third approver). The use of "WB" (Workbench) suggests integration with a specific system or module.

# 1. Executive Summary

Operation Request Portal (ORP) merupakan platform atau portal yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable yang sejalan dengan inisiatif Operations Transformation Direktorat Bank Mandiri melalui pemanfaatan teknologi untuk menciptakan proses operasional yang efisien dan efektif dalam mendorong superior performance, customer satisfaction & competitive advantage.

[START IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

The image displays the logo of **Mandiri**, which is a well-known financial institution, particularly in Indonesia.

### Visual Elements:

1. **Text Component:**
   - The word **"mandiri"** is written in lowercase letters.
   - The font is a clean, modern sans-serif typeface.
   - The color of the text is a deep **navy blue**, giving it a professional and trustworthy appearance.
   - The letters are evenly spaced and have a bold, solid weight, enhancing readability.

2. **Graphic Element (Symbol):**
   - Positioned above the text, slightly to the right, is a stylized **wavy, ribbon-like shape**.
   - The shape consists of **two connected, flowing curves** that resemble a wave or a dynamic ribbon.
   - The color is a **gradient of golden yellow to orange**, giving it a warm, energetic, and premium feel.
   - The design suggests movement, fluidity, and progress—possibly symbolizing growth, stability, or the flow of financial services.

### Layout and Composition:
- The graphic element is **asymmetrical** and **offset** above the text, creating a dynamic and balanced visual.
- The logo is set against a **plain white background**, which makes the navy blue text and golden graphic stand out clearly.
- The overall design is **minimalist and modern**, conveying professionalism, reliability, and forward-thinking.

### Interpretation:
- The name "Mandiri" means "independent" or "self-reliant" in Indonesian, which aligns with the brand’s identity as a strong, independent financial institution.
- The golden wave may symbolize prosperity, wealth, and continuous growth—key values in the banking sector.

### Summary:
This is the official logo of **Bank Mandiri**, featuring the word "mandiri" in navy blue lowercase letters, accompanied by a golden, wavy ribbon graphic above it. The design is clean, professional, and symbolic of strength, growth, and financial vitality.

2.  **Graphic Element**: Positioned above the text is a stylized, wavy ribbon or wave symbol. This graphic is rendered in a gradient of golden yellow to orange, giving it a warm, dynamic, and energetic feel. The ribbon has a smooth, flowing, undulating shape with three distinct peaks and troughs, resembling a stylized "M" or a series of waves. It has a subtle 3D effect, with highlights and shadows that suggest a glossy, ribbon-like material.

The overall composition is simple and balanced. The golden wave sits centered above the word "mandiri," creating a harmonious visual relationship. The contrast between the warm, vibrant wave and the cool, solid blue text makes the logo visually striking and memorable. The design conveys a sense of movement, progress, and reliability—qualities often associated with a financial institution.

The background of the image is plain white, which helps the logo stand out clearly.

# 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 1.1 Module objective

Dalam rangka pelaksanaan inisiatif Operations Transformation dan melengkapi implementasi Smart Branch, saat ini telah dikembangkan pembentukan Business Operation Centre (BOC) untuk menjawab kebutuhan tersebut dengan mengintegrasikan seluruh proses operation wilayah dalam satu unit operation sehingga menciptakan value bagi Bank dan Nasabah melalui percepatan TAT, Zero Operations at Business, standarisasi proses dengan penggunaan teknologi yang dapat mangakomodir seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat, implementasi kontrol yang lebih baik, serta cost effectiveness.

Saat ini telah dilakukan monitoring yang baik pada aktifitas proses pemeriksaan kesesuaian asset/barang pada sistem terhadap perhitungan fisik asset/barang yang meliputi saldo uang tunai (khasanah), inventory surat berharga (Cek & Bilyet Giro). Namun, diperlukan perbaikan pada proses verifikasi kesesuaian dengan membandingkan data fisik dan data sistem yang masih dilakukan secara manual. Maka diperlukan proses surrounding system untuk memperoleh data sistem saldo uang tunai, stock Cek & Bilyet. Sehingga proses lebih cepat, efektif, efisien serta coss effectiveness melalui Enhancement Cross Control BOC (Surrounding System).


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Enhancement pada Cross Opname Cash dengan surrounding system saldo uang tunai akhir hari | Dapat menampilkan saldo uang pada akhir hari sesuai tanggal pelaksanaan Cross Control ORP yang telah ditentukan dengan detail uang kertas IDR, uang logam IDR, valuta asing kertas dan valuta asing logam baik rincian denom, currency, jumlah lembar/keping dan jumlah nominal. |
| 2 | Enhancement pada Cross Opname Stock Inventory Surat Berharga dengan surrounding system stock Cek & Bilyet Giro | Dapat menampilkan stock Cek dan Bilyet Giro sesuai tanggal pelaksanaan Cross Control ORP yang telah ditentukan dengan detail jenis Cek & Bilyet Giro, denomination prefix, number start and end dan jumlah lembar. |
| 3 | Enhancement Generate Report Berita Acara | Dapat menampilkan generate report Berita Acara berdasarkan data hasil pelaksanaan cross control yang telah diinput pada Portal ORP. Sehingga, tidak diperlukan lagi upload dokumen Berita Acara dan pendukung lainnya. |
| 4 | Post Facto Control | Fitur baru untuk aktivitas pemeriksaan pada beberapa item seperti pengelolaan uang tunai, pemrosesan transaksi uang tunai dan pembayaran internal. |

# 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 1.1 Module objective

Dalam rangka pelaksanaan inisiatif Operations Transformation dan melengkapi implementasi Smart Branch, saat ini telah dikembangkan pembentukan Business Operation Centre (BOC) untuk menjawab kebutuhan tersebut dengan mengintegrasikan seluruh proses operation wilayah dalam satu unit operation sehingga menciptakan value bagi Bank dan Nasabah melalui percepatan TAT, Zero Operations at Business, standarisasi proses dengan penggunaan teknologi yang dapat mangakomodir seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat, implementasi kontrol yang lebih baik, serta cost effectiveness.

Saat ini telah dilakukan monitoring yang baik pada aktifitas proses pemeriksaan kesesuaian asset/barang pada sistem terhadap perhitungan fisik asset/barang yang meliputi saldo uang tunai (khasanah), inventory surat berharga (Cek & Bilyet Giro). Namun, diperlukan perbaikan pada proses verifikasi kesesuaian dengan membandingkan data fisik dan data sistem yang masih dilakukan secara manual. Maka diperlukan proses surrounding system untuk memperoleh data sistem saldo uang tunai, stock Cek & Bilyet. Sehingga proses lebih cepat, efektif, efisien serta coss effectiveness melalui Enhancement Cross Control BOC (Surrounding System).


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Enhancement pada Cross Opname Cash dengan surrounding system saldo uang tunai akhir hari | Dapat menampilkan saldo uang pada akhir hari sesuai tanggal pelaksanaan Cross Control ORP yang telah ditentukan dengan detail uang kertas IDR, uang logam IDR, valuta asing kertas dan valuta asing logam baik rincian denom, currency, jumlah lembar/keping dan jumlah nominal. |
| 2 | Enhancement pada Cross Opname Stock Inventory Surat Berharga dengan surrounding system stock Cek & Bilyet Giro | Dapat menampilkan stock Cek dan Bilyet Giro sesuai tanggal pelaksanaan Cross Control ORP yang telah ditentukan dengan detail jenis Cek & Bilyet Giro, denomination prefix, number start and end dan jumlah lembar. |
| 3 | Enhancement Generate Report Berita Acara | Dapat menampilkan generate report Berita Acara berdasarkan data hasil pelaksanaan cross control yang telah diinput pada Portal ORP. Sehingga, tidak diperlukan lagi upload dokumen Berita Acara dan pendukung lainnya. |
| 4 | Post Facto Control | Fitur baru untuk aktivitas pemeriksaan pada beberapa item seperti pengelolaan uang tunai, pemrosesan transaksi uang tunai dan pembayaran internal. |

[START IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

The image displays the logo of **Mandiri**, which is a well-known Indonesian financial institution.

### Visual Elements:

- **Text**: The word **"mandiri"** is written in lowercase letters using a bold, sans-serif typeface. The font is clean and modern, with even stroke weights and rounded terminals, giving it a professional and approachable appearance. The color of the text is a deep, dark blue, which often conveys trust, stability, and professionalism—qualities desirable in a banking or financial context.

- **Graphic Element**: Positioned above the text is a stylized, wavy, ribbon-like graphic. This element is composed of three connected, flowing curves that rise and fall in a smooth, rhythmic pattern. The color of the graphic is a gradient of **golden yellow to orange**, creating a sense of warmth, energy, and optimism. The gradient adds depth and a sense of movement to the otherwise flat design.

- **Layout**: The graphic sits slightly above and to the right of the text, overlapping the top of the letters "m", "a", and "n". This creates a dynamic, integrated look rather than a simple stacked or side-by-side arrangement. The placement suggests the wave is "flowing over" or "encompassing" the brand name.

- **Background**: The logo is set against a plain white background, which makes the dark blue text and golden graphic stand out clearly and ensures high visibility and readability.

### Symbolism and Interpretation:

- The **wave** or **ribbon** may symbolize fluidity, progress, continuity, and dynamism—qualities associated with financial services, growth, and adaptability.
- The **golden color** often represents value, excellence, and prosperity, aligning with the financial nature of the brand.
- The **lowercase typography** gives the brand a modern, accessible, and customer-centric feel, contrasting with more traditional, uppercase bank logos.

### Overall Impression:

The logo is clean, modern, and professional. It effectively combines strong typography with a dynamic graphic element to convey trust, energy, and forward movement. The color scheme of deep blue and golden yellow creates a balanced contrast that is both authoritative and inviting.

This is the official logo of **Bank Mandiri**, one of Indonesia’s largest and most prominent banks.

The image displays the logo of **Mandiri**, an Indonesian financial institution. The logo consists of two main elements: a stylized graphic mark and the company name in lowercase letters.

### 1. **Graphic Element (Wave Symbol)**
- Positioned above the text, this is a smooth, flowing, wavy line that resembles a ribbon or a stylized "M" or "W".
- The color is a gradient of warm golden-yellow, transitioning from a deeper orange-yellow on the left to a lighter, more luminous yellow on the right.
- The wave has a three-dimensional, glossy appearance, with highlights and shading that give it a sense of depth and movement.
- It has a dynamic, upward-sweeping motion, suggesting progress, energy, and fluidity.

### 2. **Text Element ("mandiri")**
- The word "mandiri" is written in lowercase letters.
- The font is a clean, modern sans-serif typeface with even stroke weight and rounded terminals.
- The color is a deep, dark blue, providing strong contrast against the white background and the golden wave above.
- The letters are tightly kerned, creating a cohesive and compact look.

### 3. **Overall Composition**
- The logo is horizontally oriented and balanced.
- The golden wave is centered above the word "mandiri", visually connecting with the top of the letters.
- The background is plain white, emphasizing the logo elements and making them stand out clearly.

### 4. **Symbolism and Branding**
- The name "Mandiri" translates to "independent" or "self-reliant" in Indonesian, reflecting the bank’s identity as a strong, self-sufficient institution.
- The wave symbol may represent growth, stability, and the flow of financial services.
- The color scheme—golden yellow and deep blue—conveys trust, professionalism, and prosperity.

This logo is widely recognized in Indonesia and is associated with **Bank Mandiri**, one of the largest banks in the country.

# 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 1.1. Module objective

Berdasarkan Hasil Pemeriksaan Auditor External (Ernst & Young) terkait penggunaan GL 19511601 akun suspend aplikasi Deposit, variasi transaksi yang dilakukan di Region/Cabang sangat beragam dan lebih condong ke arah biaya operasional dan perlu adanya pembatasan akses transSaksi ke GL 19511601.

Pembatasan ini dilakukan secara bertahap dengan prioritas utama terhadap transaksi yang frekuensinya tinggi menggunakan GL tersebut dan berpotensi menimbulkan open items.

Dari transaksi yang frekuensinya tinggi salah satu jenis transaksi yang terdampak adalah koreksi bunga Deposito, Giro dan Tabungan.

sebagai preventive kendala transaksi di Cabang maka dari itu diajukan inisiatif pengembangan proses koreksi bunga menggunakan aplikasi ORP dan BPS 2.0 sebagai permanent solution.


## 1.2. Module overview

Berdasarkan penjelasan pada bab 1.1 Module objective, maka perlu dilakukan pengembangan pada aplikasi ORP untuk mengakomordir fitur berikut:


### ORP Portal


#### 1. Input Form - Koreksi Beban Bunga

Fitur ini mengakomodir kebutuhan Cabang (Role Cabang - Operation Manager) agar dapat mengisi form koreksi beban bunga dengan terdapat 3 produk didalamnya sebagai berikut :

a. Deposito

b. Tabungan

c. Giro

Agar koreksi nominal beban bunga dapat diakomodasi, dihitung pajaknya, dan dikirim ke rekening yang sesuai.


#### 2. Form Approval Cabang - Worklist

Fitur ini mengakomodir halaman menu baru di Worklist agar user Kepala Cabang (Role Cabang - Kepala Cabang) dapat melakukan verifikasi pada Form Koreksi Beban Bunga, sebelum melakukan Approve/Reject pada Form, dengan proses review sebagai berikut :

a. Review form

b. Review dokumen

c. Review format keterangan


#### 3. Inquery Account, Status Rekening, Saldo dan jatuh tempo

Fitur ini mengakomodir kebutuhan system dapat melakukan inquery nomor rekening (Deposito/Giro/Tabungan) pada saat pengisian form Koreksi Beban Bunga yang dilakukan Cabang agar mendapat validasi data nomor rekening yang sesuai


<!-- Page break -->


4. Validasi Tax Deposito/Giro/Tabungan

Fitur ini mengakomodir proses validasi dan perhitungan koreksi beban bunga untuk produk Deposito/Giro/Tabungan, agar system dapat menentukan jurnal GL yang tepat sesuai dengan alur koreksi (Kurang Bayar/Lebih Bayar), Status Pajak dan Tanggal Window Time/Cut off Date


5. Generate File Posting

Fitur ini mengakomodir System ORP melakukan Generate File/meng-export File
GL dari hasil transaksi Koreksi Beban Bunga yang diinput di ORP. Agar dapat
digunakan untuk proses upload jurnal posting dari aplikasi BPS2.0 ke Host


6. Calculate Tax

System melakukan validasi perhitungan nilai pajak berdasarkan total nominal dan beban bunga yang di koreksi, agar system dapat mencatat jumlah pajak yang sesuai saat proses koreksi dilakukan


7. Parameter setup

Fitur ini mengakomodir kebutuhan parameter pada saat proses Koreksi Beban Bunga, dengan list parameter sebagai berikut :

a. Parameter Cut Off Time (open menu koreksi bunga dan approval)

The image displays the logo of **Mandiri**, which is a well-known Indonesian financial institution.

### Visual Elements:

- **Text**: The word **"mandiri"** is written in lowercase letters using a clean, modern sans-serif typeface. The font is bold and dark blue, giving it a professional and trustworthy appearance.
  
- **Graphic Element**: Above the text, there is a stylized, wavy, ribbon-like shape. This graphic is rendered in a gradient of warm colors, transitioning from a golden yellow on the left to a deeper orange on the right. The shape has a smooth, flowing form with three distinct peaks and valleys, resembling a stylized wave or a dynamic ribbon.

- **Color Scheme**: The primary colors are:
  - **Dark Blue** for the text, symbolizing stability, trust, and professionalism.
  - **Golden Yellow to Orange Gradient** for the wave, evoking energy, optimism, and warmth.

- **Layout**: The wave graphic is positioned directly above the word "mandiri," centered horizontally. The wave’s peaks align roughly with the top of the letters, creating a balanced and harmonious composition.

- **Background**: The logo is set against a plain white background, which enhances the visibility and clarity of the blue text and golden wave.

### Symbolism and Interpretation:

- The name **"Mandiri"** means "independent" or "self-reliant" in Indonesian, reflecting the bank’s mission to empower individuals and businesses.
- The **wavy ribbon** may symbolize fluidity, movement, and progress—perhaps representing financial flow, innovation, or the dynamic nature of the economy.
- The **color gradient** from yellow to orange suggests energy, growth, and a forward-looking vision.

### Overall Impression:

The logo conveys a sense of **modern professionalism, trustworthiness, and dynamic growth**. Its clean design and vibrant yet balanced color palette make it memorable and suitable for a major financial institution.

This is the official logo of **Bank Mandiri**, one of the largest banks in Indonesia.

# 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## Module Objective

Diantara 8 Strategic Goals Bank Mandiri tahun 2022, terdapat Operation Transformation sebagai salah satu key strategy yang perlu dijalankan untuk mendukung pertumbuhan bisnis. Hal ini diperkuat kembali dalam Rapat Direksi bulan Juli 2022 yang telah menyampaikan arahan untuk mengeksekusi operation transformation dan mengkaji kembali pemetaan ruang lingkup operation transformation. Sebagai tindak lanjut dari arahan tersebut, kami telah, sedang, dan akan terus mentransformasi seluruh aspek operations mencakup process, technology, people dan organization.

Saat ini *Workflow Management System* digunakan untuk mengakomodir operations baik di dalam Direktorat Operations maupun di luar Direktorat Operations melalui pembentukan Business Operations Center (BOC) yang merupakan integrasi seluruh kegiatan operations yang ada di suatu kota/kawasan tertentu yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable.

# 2. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 2.1. Module Objective

Diantara 8 Strategic Goals Bank Mandiri tahun 2022, terdapat Operation Transformation sebagai salah satu key strategy yang perlu dijalankan untuk mendukung pertumbuhan bisnis. Hal ini diperkuat kembali dalam Rapat Direksi bulan Juli 2022 yang telah menyampaikan arahan untuk mengeksekusi operation transformation dan mengkaji kembali pemetaan ruang lingkup operation transformation. Sebagai tindak lanjut dari arahan tersebut, kami telah, sedang, dan akan terus mentransformasi seluruh aspek operations mencakup process, technology, people dan organization.

Saat ini *Workflow Management System* digunakan untuk mengakomodir operations baik di dalam Direktorat Operations maupun di luar Direktorat Operations melalui pembentukan Business Operations Center (BOC) yang merupakan integrasi seluruh kegiatan operations yang ada di suatu kota/kawasan tertentu yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable.

Saat ini proses *Deposito Special Rate* (DSR), *Giro Special Rate* (GSR) masih dilakukan secara manual, dokumentasi yang terdesentralisasi dan terpapar risiko operasional. Oleh karena itu, dibutuhkan pengembangan Work Flow Management System untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses *Deposito Special Rate* (DSR), *Giro Special Rate* (GSR) dan pembukaan rekening *non payroll* secara *bulk*.


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Pengembangan system Workflow Management System Headoffice & BOC | Pengembangan *work flow management system* untuk proses *data entry*, validasi, persetujuan, eksekusi dan *report* atas proses permohonan permintaan Deposito Special Rate (DSR) dan Giro Special Rate (GSR), untuk permintaan baru maupun roll over. |

## 2.1. Module Objective

Diantara 8 Strategic Goals Bank Mandiri tahun 2022, terdapat Operation Transformation sebagai salah satu key strategy yang perlu dijalankan untuk mendukung pertumbuhan bisnis. Hal ini diperkuat kembali dalam Rapat Direksi bulan Juli 2022 yang telah menyampaikan arahan untuk mengeksekusi operation transformation dan mengkaji kembali pemetaan ruang lingkup operation transformation. Sebagai tindak lanjut dari arahan tersebut, kami telah, sedang, dan akan terus mentransformasi seluruh aspek operations mencakup process, technology, people dan organization.

Saat ini Workflow Management System digunakan untuk mengakomodir operations baik di dalam Direktorat Operations maupun di luar Direktorat Operations melalui pembentukan Business Operations Center (BOC) yang merupakan integrasi seluruh kegiatan operations yang ada di suatu kota/kawasan tertentu yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable.

Proses Notional Pooling saat ini masih dilakukan dengan manual dengan system BDS. Oleh Karena itu, dibutuhkan pengembangan pada Work Flow Management untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses Notional Pooling yang dilakukan secara real time.

Saat ini proses perubahan data account maintenance bulk masih dilakukan secara manual, dokumentasi yang terdesentralisasi dan terpapar risiko operasional. Oleh karena itu, dibutuhkan pengembangan Work Flow Management System untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses account maintenance secara bulk.


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Pengembangan system Workflow Management System Headoffice & BOC | Pengembangan e-channel operation engine untuk seluruh proses operasional sesuai dengan kebutuhan proses bisnis terkini dan dapat terintegrasi dengan channel transaksi digital dan core system Bank Mandiri |
| 2 | Pengembangan system Work Flow Management System pada proses Account Maintenance | Pengembangan work flow management system untuk proses data entry, validasi dan report atas permintaan account maintenance. Baik dari Cabang atau Unit Kantor Pusat yang saat ini masih dilakukan secara manual dan dalam jumlah bulk. i.e.: Perubahan status (reaktivasi) rekening, pindah kelola rekening |
| 3 | Pengembangan system Work Flow Management | Proses Notional Pooling saat ini masih dilakukan dengan manual dengan system BDS. Oleh Karena |

|  | System pada Notional Pooling | itu, dibutuhkan pengembangan pada Work Flow Management untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses Notional Pooling yang dilakukan secara real time. |

| 4 | Pengembangan system Work Flow Management System pada Priorityline KCM Wholesales | Menyediakan layanan onboarding bagi nasabah prioritas Mandiri Cash Management (MCM) yang tidak memungkinkan untuk melakukan proses onboarding melalui platform Kopra. Sistem Workflow Management System (WFMS) akan dirancang dengan kemampuan untuk memfasilitasi pendaftaran atau onboarding nasabah baru sebagai pengguna aplikasi MCM secara efektif dan efisien. |

[START IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

The image displays the logo of **Mandiri**, which is a well-known financial institution, particularly in Indonesia.

### Visual Elements:

- **Text**: The word **"mandiri"** is written in lowercase letters using a clean, modern sans-serif typeface. The font is bold and evenly spaced, giving it a professional and stable appearance.
- **Color of Text**: The letters are rendered in a deep **navy blue**, which conveys trust, reliability, and professionalism—commonly associated with financial services.
- **Graphic Element**: Above the text, there is a stylized, wavy, ribbon-like shape. This element is **golden-yellow** with a subtle gradient, giving it a sense of depth and movement. The shape resembles a flowing wave or a dynamic ribbon, suggesting energy, progress, and fluidity.
- **Positioning**: The golden wave is centered above the word "mandiri," slightly overlapping the top of the letters, creating a cohesive and balanced design.
- **Background**: The entire logo is set against a plain white background, which enhances the visibility and contrast of the blue text and golden graphic.

### Overall Impression:

The logo combines **stability** (through the solid blue text) with **vitality and dynamism** (through the golden wave). The use of lowercase letters gives it a modern, approachable feel, while the color scheme evokes trust and optimism. The design is simple yet memorable, effectively representing a financial institution that values both tradition and forward momentum.

This is the official logo of **Bank Mandiri**, one of Indonesia’s largest and most prominent banks.

[END IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

The name "Mandiri" itself means "independent" or "self-reliant" in Indonesian, which aligns with the visual metaphor of a rising or flowing wave — suggesting strength, resilience, and progress.

This logo is widely recognized as belonging to **Bank Mandiri**, one of Indonesia’s largest and most prominent banks.

# 1 EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 1.1 Module Overview

Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan pengembangan Work Flow Management System untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses Deposito Special Rate (DSR), Giro Special Rate (GSR) dan pembukaan rekening non payroll secara bulk, maka diperlukan pengembangan pada Datamart Workflow Management System (WFMS), pengembangan yang di maksud adalah pengembangan ETL Datamart yang datanya bersumber dari Datawarehouse. Data yang telah tersedia pada Datawarehouse sebelumnya diperoleh dari Core System eMAS. Proses tersebut ditujukan Sebagai penyimpanan history detail data pengajuan pinjaman. Baik digunakan untuk reporting maupun aplikasi di Bank Mandiri lainnya seperti DMS CRO.


## 1.2 Module Objective

Table 1 Module Objective


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1. | Penurunan Data eMAS ke DWH | Penurunan data satu atau beberapa table/file dari sistem eMAS ke DWH menggunakan ETL tools IBM DataStage yaitu table CDSRPAR, CDSRDTL dan DDGSRM ke Schema BMSTGCBS |
| 2. | Pengembangan datamart WFMS. | Pengembangan pada datamart WFMS yaitu mengakomodir perubahan/penambahan data dari Datawarehouse. |


## 1.3 Process


### 1.3.1 Existing Process

Bank Mandiri memiliki alur proses integrasi data dari suatu core system ke staging DWH dalam rangka pembuatan datamart atau report. Proses tersebut dilakukan menggunakan ETL Tools IBM DataStage dan umumnya dilakukan secara schedular. Pada kondisi eksisting, satu atau beberapa data pada eMAS belum diturunkan ke staging DWH sehingga diperlukan adanya pengembangan pada proses eksisting.

Salah satu kasus penggunaan data pada staging DWH ialah mengolahnya hingga membentuk sebuah data mart. Data yang ada pada data mart merupakan data yang sudah melalui mekanisme transformasi dan agregasi hingga siap digunakan untuk

ystem (DSP).

---

### **Summary**

This diagram depicts a secure, modular integration architecture where an external Workforce Management System (WFMS) accesses a core banking system (BLUE SOA COREBANK) through an internal API gateway, using API key authentication. The core banking system then communicates with a data storage/processing system (DSP) for data operations. The entire internal system is encapsulated within the "BLUE SOA" framework, emphasizing a service-oriented, secure, and scalable design.

[END IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

# 1 EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 1.1 Module Overview

Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan data WFMS Head Office yaitu data initial validation atas data entry yang bersifat non-financial, maka diperlukan adanya pengembangan pada Datamart Workflow Management System (WFMS), pengembangan yang di maksud adalah pengembangan ETL datamart data yang bersumber dari Datawarehouse. Data yang telah tersedia pada DWH Sebelumnya diperoleh dari Core System eMAS.


## 1.2 Module Objective

Table 1 Module Objective


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1. | Penurunan Data eMAS ke DWH | Penurunan data satu table/file TMIPADRL dari sistem eMAS ke DWH menggunakan ETL tools IBM DataStage |
| 2. | Pengembangan ETL WFMS. | ETL tools IBM DataStage akan mengirimkan data detail rekening, detail cabang dan data DHN ke datamart WFMS yang source datanya dari DWH |


## 1.3 Process


### 1.3.1 Existing Process

Bank Mandiri memiliki alur proses integrasi data dari suatu core system ke staging DWH dalam rangka pembuatan datamart atau report. Proses tersebut dilakukan menggunakan ETL Tools IBM DataStage dan umumnya dilakukan secara schedular.

Pada kondisi eksisting, satu atau beberapa data pada eMAS belum diturunkan ke staging DWH sehingga diperlukan adanya pengembangan pada proses eksisting.

Salah satu kasus penggunaan data pada staging DWH ialah mengolahnya hingga membentuk sebuah data mart. Data yang ada pada data mart merupakan data yang sudah melalui mekanisme transformasi hingga siap digunakan untuk kebutuhan spesifik reporting atau aplikasi. Kondisi eksisting diperlukan pengembangan pada data mart WFMS karena blm tersedianya satu atau beberapa data dari Datawarehouse.

# 3 BUSINESS PROCESS REQUIREMENT


## 3.1 Requirements

Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan Workflow Management System Scope Datamart ETL diperlukan adanya pengembangan pada data mart Workflow Management System (WFMS) menggunakan ETL. Pengembangan yang dimaksud adalah penambahan informasi terkait data detail rekening, detail cabang dan data DHN yang sumber datanya dari datawarehouse. Namun dikarenakan belum tersedianya satu atau beberapa data pada datawarehouse maka diperlukan juga pengembangan pada proses eksisting DWH yaitu penambahan table pada DWH yang bersumber dari eMAS yaitu table TMIPADRL.

## 1. BACKGROUND DESCRIPTION

Operations Transformation merupakan salah satu strategic goals Bank Mandiri untuk menjadi Undisputed Industry Leader, sebagai enabler dari transformasi digital Bank Mandiri. Operations Transformation telah dimulai sejak tahun 2022 meliputi 3 area Loan, Transaction dan Service. Melalui transformasi proses, teknologi, people & organization, Operations


<!-- Page break -->


- Title Work Flow Management System (WFMS) Project Workflow for Head Office - Host eMAS
- Author Pradipta Mulia Insani Page 4 of 20
- Status Final Version 1.0

mandiri

Transformation diharapkan dapat memberikan dampak baik bagi Cabang maupun Kantor Pusat terhadap percepatan proses, peningkatan capacity, cost effectiveness dan risk preventive.

Saat ini proses Deposito Special Rate (DSR), Giro Special Rate (GSR) dan pembukaan rekening non payroll secara bulk masih dilakukan secara manual, dokumentasi yang terdesentralisasi dan terpapar risiko operasional. Oleh karena itu, dibutuhkan pengembangan Work Flow Management System untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses Deposito Special Rate (DSR), Giro Special Rate (GSR) dan pembukaan rekening non payroll secara bulk. WFMS akan menjalankan proses inquiry ke eMAS untuk setiap Nomor rekening yang akan diproses. Datamart akan memberikan respon hasil inquiry, berdasarkan kebutuhan data dari masing-masing menu/ fungsi yang dijalankan.

# 2. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 2.1 Module Objective

Diantara 8 Strategic Goals Bank Mandiri tahun 2022, terdapat Operation Transformation sebagai salah satu key strategy yang perlu dijalankan untuk mendukung pertumbuhan bisnis. Hal ini diperkuat kembali dalam Rapat Direksi bulan Juli 2022 yang telah menyampaikan arahan untuk mengeksekusi operation transformation dan mengkaji kembali pemetaan ruang lingkup operation transformation. Sebagai tindak lanjut dari arahan tersebut, kami telah, sedang, dan akan terus mentransformasi seluruh aspek operations mencakup process, technology, people dan organization.


<!-- Page break -->

Untuk mengakomodir operations baik di dalam Direktorat Operations maupun di luar Direktorat Operations melalui pembentukan Business Operations Center (BOC) yang merupakan integrasi seluruh kegiatan operations yang ada di suatu kota/kawasan tertentu, maka diperlukan sistem yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable melalui pengembangan Workflow Management System.

# 2. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 2.1. Module Objective

Diantara 8 Strategic Goals Bank Mandiri tahun 2022, terdapat Operation Transformation sebagai salah satu key strategy yang perlu dijalankan untuk mendukung pertumbuhan bisnis. Hal ini diperkuat kembali dalam Rapat Direksi bulan Juli 2022 yang telah menyampaikan arahan untuk mengeksekusi operation transformation dan mengkaji kembali pemetaan ruang lingkup operation transformation. Sebagai tindak lanjut dari arahan tersebut, kami telah, sedang, dan akan terus mentransformasi seluruh aspek operations mencakup process, technology, people dan organization.

Saat ini *Workflow Management System* digunakan untuk mengakomodir operations baik di dalam Direktorat Operations maupun di luar Direktorat Operations melalui pembentukan Business Operations Center (BOC) yang merupakan integrasi seluruh kegiatan operations yang ada di suatu kota/kawasan tertentu yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable.

Saat ini proses *Deposito Special Rate* (DSR), *Giro Special Rate* (GSR) masih dilakukan secara manual, dokumentasi yang terdesentralisasi dan terpapar risiko operasional. Oleh karena itu, dibutuhkan pengembangan Work Flow Management System untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses *Deposito Special Rate* (DSR), *Giro Special Rate* (GSR) dan pembukaan rekening *non payroll* secara *bulk*.


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Pengembangan system Workflow Management System Headoffice & BOC | Pengembangan *work flow management system* untuk proses *data entry*, validasi, persetujuan, eksekusi dan *report* atas proses permohonan permintaan Deposito Special Rate (DSR) dan Giro Special Rate (GSR), untuk permintaan baru maupun roll over. |

### **1. Front End (Leftmost Column)**

This column represents the various user-facing or operational units that interact with the system. Each is represented by a colored arrow with a logo and name:

- **livin by mandiri** (Yellow arrow): A digital banking or lifestyle platform.
- **kopra** (Teal arrow): Likely a digital platform for business or financial services.
- **smart branch by mandiri** (Blue arrow): A modernized branch service platform.
- **Business Unit** (Orange arrow): Represents internal business units.
- **Third Party** (Gray arrow): External partners or systems.

---

### **2. Process (Second Column from Left)**

ystem (DSP).

---

### **Summary**

This diagram depicts a secure, modular integration architecture where an external Workforce Management System (WFMS) accesses a core banking system (BLUE SOA COREBANK) through an internal API gateway, using API key authentication. The core banking system then communicates with a data storage/processing system (DSP) for data operations. The entire internal system is encapsulated within the "BLUE SOA" framework, emphasizing a service-oriented, secure, and scalable design.

# 1 EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 1.1 Module Overview

Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan data WFMS Head Office yaitu data initial validation atas data entry yang bersifat non-financial, maka diperlukan adanya pengembangan pada Datamart Workflow Management System (WFMS), pengembangan yang di maksud adalah pengembangan ETL datamart data yang bersumber dari Datawarehouse. Data yang telah tersedia pada DWH Sebelumnya diperoleh dari Core System eMAS.


## 1.2 Module Objective

Table 1 Module Objective


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1. | Penurunan Data eMAS ke DWH | Penurunan data satu table/file TMIPADRL dari sistem eMAS ke DWH menggunakan ETL tools IBM DataStage |
| 2. | Pengembangan ETL WFMS. | ETL tools IBM DataStage akan mengirimkan data detail rekening, detail cabang dan data DHN ke datamart WFMS yang source datanya dari DWH |


## 1.3 Process


### 1.3.1 Existing Process

Bank Mandiri memiliki alur proses integrasi data dari suatu core system ke staging DWH dalam rangka pembuatan datamart atau report. Proses tersebut dilakukan menggunakan ETL Tools IBM DataStage dan umumnya dilakukan secara schedular.

Pada kondisi eksisting, satu atau beberapa data pada eMAS belum diturunkan ke staging DWH sehingga diperlukan adanya pengembangan pada proses eksisting.

Salah satu kasus penggunaan data pada staging DWH ialah mengolahnya hingga membentuk sebuah data mart. Data yang ada pada data mart merupakan data yang sudah melalui mekanisme transformasi hingga siap digunakan untuk kebutuhan spesifik reporting atau aplikasi. Kondisi eksisting diperlukan pengembangan pada data mart WFMS karena blm tersedianya satu atau beberapa data dari Datawarehouse.

## 2. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


<!-- Page break -->


## 2.1. Module Objective

Diantara 8 Strategic Goals Bank Mandiri tahun 2022, terdapat Operation Transformation sebagai salah satu key strategy yang perlu dijalankan untuk mendukung pertumbuhan bisnis. Hal ini diperkuat kembali dalam Rapat Direksi bulan Juli 2022 yang telah menyampaikan arahan untuk mengeksekusi operation transformation dan mengkaji kembali pemetaan ruang lingkup operation transformation. Sebagai tindak lanjut dari arahan tersebut, kami telah, sedang, dan akan terus mentransformasi seluruh aspek operations mencakup process, technology, people dan organization.

Saat ini Workflow Management System digunakan untuk mengakomodir operations baik di dalam Direktorat Operations maupun di luar Direktorat Operations melalui pembentukan Business Operations Center (BOC) yang merupakan integrasi seluruh kegiatan operations yang ada di suatu kota/kawasan tertentu yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable.

Proses Notional Pooling saat ini masih dilakukan dengan manual dengan system BDS. Oleh Karena itu, dibutuhkan pengembangan pada Work Flow Management untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses Notional Pooling yang dilakukan secara real time.

Saat ini proses perubahan data account maintenance bulk masih dilakukan secara manual, dokumentasi yang terdesentralisasi dan terpapar risiko operasional. Oleh karena itu, dibutuhkan pengembangan Work Flow Management System untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses account maintenance secara bulk.


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Pengembangan system Workflow Management System Headoffice & BOC | Pengembangan e-channel operation engine untuk seluruh proses operasional sesuai dengan kebutuhan proses bisnis terkini dan dapat terintegrasi dengan channel transaksi digital dan core system Bank Mandiri |
| 2 | Pengembangan system Work Flow Management System pada proses Account Maintenance | Pengembangan work flow management system untuk proses data entry, validasi dan report atas permintaan account maintenance. Baik dari Cabang atau Unit Kantor Pusat yang saat ini masih dilakukan secara manual dan dalam jumlah bulk. i.e.: Perubahan status (reaktivasi) rekening, pindah kelola rekening |
| 3 | Pengembangan system Work Flow Management | Proses Notional Pooling saat ini masih dilakukan dengan manual dengan system BDS. Oleh Karena |


<!-- Page break -->


|  | System pada Notional Pooling | itu, dibutuhkan pengembangan pada Work Flow Management untuk otomasi & digitalisasi proses Notional Pooling yang dilakukan secara real time. |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 4 | Pengembangan system Work Flow Management System pada Priorityline KCM Wholesales | Menyediakan layanan onboarding bagi nasabah prioritas Mandiri Cash Management (MCM) yang tidak memungkinkan untuk melakukan proses onboarding melalui platform Kopra. Sistem Workflow Management System (WFMS) akan dirancang dengan kemampuan untuk memfasilitasi pendaftaran atau onboarding nasabah baru sebagai pengguna aplikasi MCM secara efektif dan efisien. |

# 3 BUSINESS PROCESS REQUIREMENT


## 3.1 Requirements

Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan Workflow Management System Scope Datamart ETL diperlukan adanya pengembangan pada data mart Workflow Management System (WFMS). Pengembangan yang dimaksud adalah penambahan atau perubahan informasi terkait data yang bersumber data datawarehouse eMas. Namun dikarenakan belum tersedianya satu atau beberapa data pada datawarehouse maka diperlukan pengembangan pada proses eksisting DWH yaitu penambahan table pada DWH yang bersumber dari eMAS. Pengembangan yang dimaksud adalah penambahan table pada schema BMSTGCBS.


## 3.2 Proposed Solutions

Table 2 Proposed Solutions Business Process Requirement


| No | Requirement Name | Proposed Solutions |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1. | Penurunan data dari core system eMAS ke DWH. | Penggunaan ETL tool IBM DataStage untuk menurunkan data dari eMAS ke DWH yaitu table pada schema BMSTGCBS. |
| 2. | Pengembangan ETL Pembentukan Datamart | Pengembangan pada ETL proses dalam pembentukan datamart serta pengembangan datamart Workflow Management System (WFMS) untuk dapat memenuhi kebutuhan bisnis |

## 4.2 Proposed Solution


### 4.2.1 Pengembangan ETL Job Penurunan Data Dari Core System eMAS ke DWH

Pengembangan pada database DWH yaitu Penurunan table CDSRPAR, CDSRDTL dan DDGSRM pada schema existing DWH (BMSTGCBS), data tersebut bersumber dari source system EMAS. Penurunan data tersebut ditujukan untuk mengakomodir history detail data pengajuan pinjaman.


### 4.2.2 Pengembangan ETL Job Pembentukan Datamart

Pengembangan ETL untuk melakukan feedimg data dari DWH ke Datamart Workflow Management System (WFMS) menggunakan ETL Tools IBM Data Stage. Pengembangan datamart tersebut ditujukan untuk mengakomodir kebutuhan validasi di WFMS.

ontinue beyond this point (perhaps looping back to the start or moving to another phase not shown in the diagram).

---

### **Summary of Key Elements**
- **Start Event**: Green circle with briefcase (message start).
- **Multi-instance Gateway**: [Split For Each] — processes each item individually.
- **Exclusive Gateway**: Review Result — splits into three paths.
- **Tasks**:
  - **Decision History** (blue) — likely a logging or record-keeping task.
  - **Count Time Process** (yellow with hammer) — automated time-tracking or calculation.
  - **Update Data to Database** (yellow with hammer) — data persistence.
  - **Change to Initiation Stage** (yellow with arrow) — state transition.
- **End Events**: Red circles with flag — indicate termination of a process path.
- **Compensation Marker**: Red flag on the "Send back" path — suggests a corrective or rollback action.

---

### **Interpretation**
This BPMN diagram models a **review workflow** where each item (e.g., a request or application) is processed individually. After review, the item can be:
- **Approved** → logged, time counted, data updated, and process ends.
- **Rejected** → logged, time counted, and process ends.
- **Sent back** → logged, time counted, and the item is reverted to an earlier stage (Initiation), possibly requiring re-submission or correction.

The use of **compensation** on the "Send back" path suggests that the system may need to undo or reverse actions taken during the review process before re-initiating.

---

### **Visual Style**
- Clean, minimalistic design with clear color coding:
  - **Green** = Start
  - **Blue** = Tasks (possibly subprocesses or user tasks)
  - **Orange** = Decision Gateway
  - **Yellow** = Service/automated tasks
  - **Red** = End events
- Icons inside shapes provide additional context (e.g., hammer = service task, plus = subprocess, flag = compensation).

---

This diagram effectively communicates a structured, conditional workflow with clear branching logic and process termination points.

[END IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

The image displays the logo of **Mandiri**, which is a well-known financial institution, particularly in Indonesia.

### Visual Elements:

- **Text**: The word **"mandiri"** is written in lowercase letters using a clean, modern sans-serif typeface. The font is bold and evenly spaced, giving it a professional and stable appearance.
- **Color of Text**: The letters are in a deep **navy blue**, which conveys trust, reliability, and professionalism—commonly associated with banking and financial services.
- **Graphic Element**: Above the text, there is a stylized, wavy, ribbon-like graphic. It consists of three undulating peaks and valleys, resembling a flowing wave or a dynamic ribbon.
- **Color of Graphic**: The wave is rendered in a **gradient of golden yellow to orange**, giving it a sense of warmth, energy, and optimism. The gradient adds depth and a three-dimensional effect.
- **Positioning**: The wave is centered horizontally above the word "mandiri," slightly overlapping the top of the letters, creating a cohesive and balanced design.

### Overall Impression:

The logo combines **stability** (through the solid, dark blue text) with **movement and vitality** (through the golden, flowing wave). This duality may symbolize the bank’s commitment to steady, reliable service while also being dynamic, forward-thinking, and customer-focused.

The design is simple, clean, and easily recognizable, suitable for branding across various media.

---

**Note**: This is the logo of **Bank Mandiri**, one of the largest banks in Indonesia. The name "Mandiri" translates to "independent" or "self-reliant" in Indonesian, reflecting the bank’s mission and values.

[START IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

This image displays a screenshot of a banking transaction authorization interface from **Bank Mandiri**, an Indonesian financial institution. The interface is designed for managing and approving electronic payments, specifically for an "Inward SKN DN" (likely a domestic incoming remittance or fund transfer) under the "Remittance" section.

---

### **Layout Overview**

The screen is divided into several sections:

- **Left Sidebar**: Navigation menu with options: Home, Dashboard, and Remittance (expanded to show Inward SKN DN and Outward SKN DN).
- **Top Bar**: Contains the Bank Mandiri logo, a back arrow, and user information: **Roberto Santos, Administrator**.
- **Main Content Area**: Divided into three primary sections:
  1. **Informasi Rekening** (Account Information)
  2. **Daftar Otorisasi** (Authorization List)
  3. **Sign Preview** (Signature Preview)

---

### **1. Informasi Rekening (Account Information)**

This section displays details of the transaction and the recipient account:

- **Nomor Rekening (Account Number)**: `070-00-0004352-6`
- **Nama (Name)**: `Universitas Paramadina Mulya` (Paramadina Mulya University)
- **Transaction**: `135,863,00` (likely in Indonesian Rupiah, Rp)
- **Keterangan (Description)**: `DUA TTD KOMBINASI A+B` (Two Signatures Combination A+B)
- **Branch Code**: `07002`
- **Jenis Server (Server Type)**: `Local Server`
- **NPWP (Tax Identification Number)**: `JL GATOT SUBROTO 96-97 JKT` (Note: This appears to be an address, not a valid NPWP format; likely a system error or placeholder)
- **Daftar Hitam (Blacklist)**: Checkbox is unchecked.

---

### **2. Daftar Otorisasi (Authorization List)**

This section manages the multi-level authorization process for the transaction.

#### **Authorization List**

- **Transaction Limit**: `Rp. 135,863,00` (matches the transaction amount)
- **Group 000001** (expanded):
  - `10 - (A) DIDIK KARIM (KETUA UMUM)` (Chairman)
  - `4 - (B) HENDRO SAID (BENDAHARA)` (Treasurer)
- **Group 000002** (collapsed)
- **Group 000003** (collapsed)

This suggests a hierarchical or group-based approval system, where specific individuals or groups must approve the transaction.

#### **Tanda Tangan yang Tersedia (Available Signatures)**

A list of individuals whose signatures can be used for approval:

- `10 - (A) DIDIK KARIM (KETUA UMUM)` — unchecked
- `4 - (B) HENDRO SAID (BENDAHARA)` — unchecked
- `6 - (B) SILMY KARIM (SEKRETARIS)` — unchecked
- `11 - (B) SUDIRMAN (KETUA 1)` — **checked**

This indicates that **Sudirman (Ketua 1)** has been selected as the approver for this transaction.

---

### **3. Sign Preview**

This section displays the digital signatures of authorized individuals, allowing the user to review and select which signatures to apply.

Each signature card contains:

- A **checkbox** labeled "Pilih" (Select)
- A button "Sesuaikan Gambar" (Adjust Image)
- A preview of the **signature image**
- Fields for:
  - **Image ID** (1, 2, 3, ...)
  - **Name** (e.g., A) AGUS SAPTANA, B) SURYANITA, C) JOKO)
  - **ID Card** (empty or placeholder)

Currently, the first two signatures are selected:

- **Image ID 1**: Signature of **A) AGUS SAPTANA**
- **Image ID 2**: Signature of **B) SURYANITA**

The third signature (C) JOKO) is not selected.

---

### **Bottom Controls**

At the bottom of the screen:

- **Back** button
- **Validasi** (Validate) button — likely the final step to approve the transaction with the selected signatures.

---

### **Overall Interpretation**

This is a **multi-signature authorization screen** for a corporate or institutional bank transaction. The transaction amount is **Rp 135,863,00**, and it is being processed for **Universitas Paramadina Mulya**. The system requires **two signatures** (as indicated by "DUA TTD KOMBINASI A+B"), and the user has selected the signatures of **Agus Saptana** and **Suryanita** (Image IDs 1 and 2). Additionally, the system has marked **Sudirman (Ketua 1)** as the approving authority in the authorization list.

The interface is clean, modern, and structured for secure, multi-level financial approvals, typical of corporate online banking systems in Indonesia.

---

### **Note on Potential Issues**

- The **NPWP field** contains an address (`JL GATOT SUBROTO 96-97 JKT`) instead of a tax ID number, which may be a data entry error or a placeholder.
- The **signature preview** shows only three signatures, but the transaction requires "A+B" — which may refer to the roles or groups, not necessarily the individuals shown here.
- The **selected approver (Sudirman)** is not visible in the Sign Preview section, suggesting that the authorization list and signature preview may be separate steps or that Sudirman's signature is not stored in the preview list.

---

### **Conclusion**

This is a **Bank Mandiri corporate transaction authorization screen** for an incoming remittance to Universitas Paramadina Mulya. The user is in the process of validating the transaction by selecting two required digital signatures (Agus Saptana and Suryanita) and has chosen Sudirman as the approving authority. The final step is to click **Validasi** to complete the approval.

Below the DNS, two **Front End Server** groups are shown, one in DC and one in DRC. Each group contains two server icons with IP addresses and port numbers (e.g., `10.10.1.1`, `Port 443`). These likely handle incoming HTTP/HTTPS traffic.

Further down, two **Back End Server** groups (DC and DRC) each contain two servers. These are connected to the Front End Servers and likely process business logic.

Below the Back End Servers, two **Database Server** groups (DC and DRC) are shown, each with two servers running **SQL Server** (indicated by the SQL logo). These are connected to the Back End Servers and are managed via DNS `mclsdbs.corp.bankmandiri.co.id`.

This indicates a well-structured, redundant, and geographically separated (DC/DRC) core infrastructure.

---

## **Middle Section: REST API & Internal Systems (SURROUNDING)**

This section shows the **REST API** as a central hub connecting to various internal and external systems.

### **REST API**
A central hexagonal icon labeled "REST API" acts as an integration layer. It connects to:

1. **LIVIN'** — Mobile banking app (icon: smartphone)
2. **NEW BDS** — New Banking Delivery System (icon: desktop)
3. **KOPRA** — Likely a core banking or processing system (icon: cube)

5. **SOA** — Service-Oriented Architecture (icon: gear)

8. **MASS PREPAID SYSTEM (MPS)** — For prepaid services

### **Additional Systems Connected to REST API**

## **Bottom Section: External Integrations & Infrastructure (SURROUNDING)**

## **Communication Protocols & Connections**

Various communication protocols are labeled along the lines:

## **Overall Architecture Summary**

This is a **highly redundant, distributed, and secure enterprise architecture** with:

- **High Availability**: DC and DRC are mirrored for disaster recovery.
- **Layered Design**: Front End → Back End → Database → Integration → External Systems.
- **API-Driven Integration**: REST API serves as the central integration point for internal and external systems.
- **Compliance & Security**: Use of SFTP, DNS, Active Directory, and secure ports (e.g., 443) indicates security best practices.
- **External Connectivity**: Integrations with Bank Indonesia (BI FAST), WhatsApp, and third-party vendors.

This architecture supports a modern digital banking environment with capabilities for mobile banking, real-time payments, data warehousing, reporting, and secure external communications.

[START IMAGE DESCRIPTION]

The image displays the logo of **Mandiri**, which is a well-known Indonesian financial institution.

### Visual Elements:

- **Text**: The word **"mandiri"** is written in lowercase letters using a bold, sans-serif typeface. The font is clean and modern, with even stroke weights and rounded terminals, giving it a professional and approachable appearance. The color of the text is a deep, dark blue, which often conveys trust, stability, and professionalism—qualities desirable in a banking or financial context.

- **Graphic Element**: Positioned above the text is a stylized, wavy, ribbon-like graphic. This element is composed of three connected, flowing curves that rise and fall in a smooth, rhythmic pattern. The color of the graphic is a gradient of **golden yellow to orange**, creating a sense of warmth, energy, and optimism. The gradient adds depth and a sense of movement to the otherwise flat design.

- **Layout**: The graphic sits slightly above and to the right of the text, overlapping the top of the letters "m", "a", and "n". This creates a dynamic, integrated look rather than a simple stacked or side-by-side arrangement. The placement suggests the wave is "flowing over" or "encompassing" the brand name.

- **Background**: The logo is set against a plain white background, which makes the dark blue text and golden graphic stand out clearly and ensures high visibility and readability.

### Symbolism and Interpretation:

- The **wave** or **ribbon** may symbolize fluidity, progress, continuity, and dynamism—qualities associated with financial services, growth, and adaptability.
- The **golden color** often represents value, excellence, and prosperity, aligning with the financial nature of the brand.
- The **lowercase typography** gives the brand a modern, accessible, and customer-centric feel, contrasting with more traditional, uppercase bank logos.

### Overall Impression:

The logo is clean, modern, and professional. It effectively combines strong typography with a dynamic graphic element to convey trust, energy, and forward movement. The color scheme of deep blue and golden yellow creates a balanced contrast that is both authoritative and inviting.

This is the official logo of **Bank Mandiri**, one of Indonesia’s largest and most prominent banks.

# 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 1.1. Module objective

Operation Transformation merupakan salah satu strategic goals Bank Mandiri untuk menjadi Undisputed Industry Leader, sebagai enabler dari transformasi digital Bank Mandiri. Operation Transformation telah dimulai sejak tahun 2022 mencakup area Loan, Transaction, dan Service. Melalui transformasi proses, technology, people & organization, Operation Transformation telah memberikan dampak baik terhadap percepatan proses, peningkatan capacity, dan cost effectiveness.

# 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## Module Objective

Diantara 8 Strategic Goals Bank Mandiri tahun 2022, terdapat Operation Transformation sebagai salah satu key strategy yang perlu dijalankan untuk mendukung pertumbuhan bisnis. Hal ini diperkuat kembali dalam Rapat Direksi bulan Juli 2022 yang telah menyampaikan arahan untuk mengeksekusi operation transformation dan mengkaji kembali pemetaan ruang lingkup operation transformation. Sebagai tindak lanjut dari arahan tersebut, kami telah, sedang, dan akan terus mentransformasi seluruh aspek operations mencakup process, technology, people dan organization.

Saat ini *Workflow Management System* digunakan untuk mengakomodir operations baik di dalam Direktorat Operations maupun di luar Direktorat Operations melalui pembentukan Business Operations Center (BOC) yang merupakan integrasi seluruh kegiatan operations yang ada di suatu kota/kawasan tertentu yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable.

The process involves multiple departments and roles, with clear handoffs, approvals, and system interactions. --- ## **Overall Structure** The diagram is divided into **three main vertical sections**: 1. **Left Section**: Initial verification and assessment phase. 2. **Middle Section**: Approval and decision-making phase involving multiple departments. 3. **Right Section**: System update and final execution phase. The flow is primarily **left-to-right**, with some **feedback loops** and **parallel paths**. It uses standard flowchart symbols: - **Rectangles**: Process steps or actions. - **Ovals**: Departments or roles (e.g., Treasury, Market Risk). - **Dashed lines**: Indicate reporting lines or organizational hierarchy (e.g., "AI Pengajuan" = Approval for submission). - **Solid arrows**: Flow of process or data. - **Labels on arrows**: Indicate triggers or methods (e.g., "WL" = Worklist, "WB" = Workbench). --- ## **Left Section: Initial Verification & Assessment** This section begins with the initiation of a DSR application. ### **Step 1: Application Initiation** - **WB/RF Pengajuan DSR** (Workbench/Request Form for DSR Application) → triggers verification. - **WBH/RFH verifikasi pengajuan DSR** (WBH/RFH verifies DSR application) → connects to **Treasury** (oval) and **Market Risk** (oval). ### **Step 2: Assessment Preparation** - **BU KP Maker Pengajuan DSR** (Business Unit KP Maker submits DSR application) → triggers **BU KP Approval verifikasi pengajuan DSR** (BU KP Approval verifies application). - **Aico Maker** (a role or system) performs: - **download Pengajuan DSR untuk assessment** (downloads DSR application for assessment) - **Upload hasil assessment** (uploads assessment results) ### **Step 3: System Generation** - **WFMS generate hasil Assessment ALCO ke WL** (WorkFlow Management System generates ALCO assessment results to Worklist). - Includes: - ALCO (Asset Liability Committee) - Approval BU KP - RFH/VBH (likely Risk Function Head / Vice Head) This step feeds into the middle section. --- ## **Middle Section: Approval & Decision-Making** This section is structured into **three parallel approval streams**, each corresponding to a different department: **Treasury**, **Market Risk**, and **Region/Business Unit**. Each stream follows a similar pattern: ### **Pattern for Each Department:** 1. **Maker** generates a PDF of the DSR application. 2. **Director** (of the department) reviews and approves. 3. **Verifier** (Aico) verifies the director’s approval. 4. The process is triggered via **WL (Worklist)** and labeled **"For each"**, indicating this loop runs for each department. --- ### **1. Treasury Stream** - **Aico Maker generate PDF pengajuan DSR** → **Direktur Aico** (Director Aico) performs approval → **Verifikator Aico** (Aico Verifier) verifies the approval. - Reporting line: **Treasury → Dir Treasury → Treasury** (dashed lines labeled "AI Pengajuan"). ### **2. Market Risk Stream** - **Aico Maker** (same role) → **Direktur Manajemen Risiko** (Director of Risk Management) → **Verifikator Aico**. - Reporting line: **Market Risk → Dir Manajemen Risiko → Market Risk**.

# 2. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


## 2.1 Module Objective

Diantara 8 Strategic Goals Bank Mandiri tahun 2022, terdapat Operation Transformation sebagai salah satu key strategy yang perlu dijalankan untuk mendukung pertumbuhan bisnis. Hal ini diperkuat kembali dalam Rapat Direksi bulan Juli 2022 yang telah menyampaikan arahan untuk mengeksekusi operation transformation dan mengkaji kembali pemetaan ruang lingkup operation transformation. Sebagai tindak lanjut dari arahan tersebut, kami telah, sedang, dan akan terus mentransformasi seluruh aspek operations mencakup process, technology, people dan organization.


<!-- Page break -->

Untuk mengakomodir operations baik di dalam Direktorat Operations maupun di luar Direktorat Operations melalui pembentukan Business Operations Center (BOC) yang merupakan integrasi seluruh kegiatan operations yang ada di suatu kota/kawasan tertentu, maka diperlukan sistem yang mengatur seluruh proses operasional secara seamless, cepat dan scalable melalui pengembangan Workflow Management System.


| No | Objective Name | Objective Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Pengembangan system Workflow Management System Headoffice & BOC | Pengembangan e-channel operation engine untuk seluruh proses operasional sesuai dengan kebutuhan proses bisnis terkini dan dapat terintegrasi dengan channel transaksi digital dan core system Bank Mandiri |
